https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Hi! I'm Elsa of Arendelle. Help me create a single line.

callouts.move_elsa_forward: Drag a "Move Forward" block and snap it below the "When Run" block to make Elsa move forward

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Now let's see if we can create two lines that are at a 90 degree angle to each other. You will need to use the "Turn" block as well as the "Move" block.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Now let's see if we can create two lines that are at a 90 degree angle to each other. You will need to use the "Turn" block as well as the "Move" block.

callouts.turn_elsa: Use the "Turn" block to make Elsa turn. The number in the drop-down determines how much Elsa turns

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: It seems like we're halfway to making a square. Let's put 4 lines together to create a square.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: It seems like we're halfway to making a square. Let's put 4 lines together to create a square.

callouts.frozen_create_square: Attach more blocks here to create a square

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Hi, I’m Anna of Arendelle! Let’s make a square with the “Repeat” block, which uses fewer blocks. How many times (???) should the “Repeat” block loop the blocks inside it to make a square?
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Hi, I’m Anna of Arendelle! Let’s make a square with the “Repeat” block, which uses fewer blocks. How many times (???) should the “Repeat” block loop the blocks inside it to make a square?

callouts.replace_questions: Use the drop-down to replace "???" with a number

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Let's create three squares, turning after each square. Be sure to turn by 120 degrees before each new square.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Let's create three squares, turning after each square. Be sure to turn by 120 degrees before each new square.

callouts.replace_questions: Use the drop-down to replace "???" with a number

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Can you create a snowflake using the “Repeat” block to make a square 10 times, and the “Turn” block to turn 36 degrees between each square?
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Can you create a snowflake using the “Repeat” block to make a square 10 times, and the “Turn” block to turn 36 degrees between each square?

callouts.replace_questions: Use the drop-down to replace "???" with a number

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Wrap a “Repeat” block around these commands to create a plus sign. Did you notice Elsa can move forward and backward?
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Wrap a “Repeat” block around these commands to create a plus sign. Did you notice Elsa can move forward and backward?

callouts.repeat_blocks_1: (1) Use this block and put it around the grey blocks in the workspace
callouts.repeat_blocks_2: (2) Move the "Repeat" block here, and place the gray blocks inside

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Now try repeating it 10 times. How many degrees do you need to turn between each line?
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Now try repeating it 10 times. How many degrees do you need to turn between each line?

callouts.replace_questions_degree: Use the drop-down to replace "???" with a number

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Let's repeat it 90 times! How many times does 90 go into 360? Hint: It's a really small number.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Let's repeat it 90 times! How many times does 90 go into 360? Hint: It's a really small number.

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Use a repeat around these blocks to create a parallelogram. It's just like a rectangle but has different angles. This one has 60 degree and 120 degree angles instead of all 90 degree angles.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Use a repeat around these blocks to create a parallelogram. It's just like a rectangle but has different angles. This one has 60 degree and 120 degree angles instead of all 90 degree angles.

callouts.frozen_diamond_repeat: Use the repeat block to create this shape.

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Did you know every snowflake is a different shape? Let's create a new snowflake by using another “Repeat" block to repeat a parallelogram 4 times, turning right by 90 degrees between each parallelogram.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Did you know every snowflake is a different shape? Let's create a new snowflake by using another “Repeat" block to repeat a parallelogram 4 times, turning right by 90 degrees between each parallelogram.

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Now, let's create a new snowflake by using the repeat block to repeat a parallelogram 10 times, turning right by 36 degrees between each one.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Now, let's create a new snowflake by using the repeat block to repeat a parallelogram 10 times, turning right by 36 degrees between each one.

callouts.frozen_diamond_repeat: Use the repeat block to create this shape.

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: A circle is a special shape. Can you figure out what number to replace the question marks with to draw a circle?
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: A circle is a special shape. Can you figure out what number to replace the question marks with to draw a circle?

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Use the new “Create a circle” block to create 10 overlapping circles. Don't forget to jump forward between circles.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Use the new “Create a circle” block to create 10 overlapping circles. Don't forget to jump forward between circles.

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Now let's create 20 overlapping circles, turning 18 degrees between each circle.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Now let's create 20 overlapping circles, turning 18 degrees between each circle.

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Here's a ”Create circle” block that can make circles of different sizes. Can you use this to create a small circle of size 5 and a larger circle of size 10?
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Here's a ”Create circle” block that can make circles of different sizes. Can you use this to create a small circle of size 5 and a larger circle of size 10?

callouts.frozen_circle_function_with_parameter_ci: Use the "create a circle" block and change the size.

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Intricate snow patterns can be created with very simple shapes. Can you make a pattern by repeating 5 circles of size 5 and 5 circles of size 10?
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Intricate snow patterns can be created with very simple shapes. Can you make a pattern by repeating 5 circles of size 5 and 5 circles of size 10?

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.short_instructions: Try using the ”Create a snowflake branch” block to create three branches, which starts to look like a snowflake.
https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Try using the ”Create a snowflake branch” block to create three branches, which starts to look like a snowflake.

https://studio.code.org/s/frozen/lessons.long_instructions: Now let's repeat it 8 times to make a beautiful snowflake!
